elements.title: Bob Foster
elements.contents: ... that Bob Foster named a small cactus species (pictured) after his best friend, Charlie Glass, with whom he undertook more than a dozen plant-hunting expeditions to Mexico?

elements.title: Sign
elements.contents: ... that Autechre used something called "the system" during the composition of Sign?

elements.title: a Roman Catholic archbishop
elements.contents: ... that a Roman Catholic archbishop was the first person to translate William Shakespeare's works into Polish?

elements.title: the longest cave in Arkansas
elements.contents: ... that there was once a stalagmite heist from the longest cave in Arkansas?

elements.title: Deoksugung
elements.contents: ... that the Korean royal palace Deoksugung mixes Korean and Western architectural styles?

elements.title: May You Stay Forever Young
elements.contents: ... that May You Stay Forever Young is the first Hong Kong film to be banned following the amendment of the Film Censorship Ordinance?

elements.title: Reine Abbas
elements.contents: ... that Reine Abbas chose the name Wixel Studios, a blend of "Weird Pixel", in recognition of being one of the only gaming studios in Lebanon?

elements.title: Ayn al-Kurum
elements.contents: ... that the Ibn Shillif brothers, evading the Ottoman authorities' pursuit after leading a local rebellion, found safe haven in the Alawite villages of Ayn al-Kurum and Annab?

elements.title: Tina Leung
elements.contents: ... that Tina Leung dressed as her comic book alter ego when accepting an award for the House of Slay?
